name: Bosnia and Herzegovina
description: Bosnia and Herzegovina, a landlocked country in the Balkan Peninsula, boasts a complex history and stunning natural beauty. Characterized by rugged mountains, dense forests, and a network of rivers and lakes, it offers a diverse range of landscapes and experiences. The country’s cultural heritage is a blend of Ottoman, Austro-Hungarian, and Slavic influences, reflected in its architecture, cuisine, and traditions.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Sarajevo is the vibrant capital city, a melting pot of cultures and a testament to resilience.
quickFacts.detail: It’s known for its Ottoman-era architecture, lively markets, and rich history.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Bosnia and Herzegovina has a population of approximately 3.25 million people.
quickFacts.detail: The population is ethnically diverse, with Bosniaks, Serbs, and Croats forming the majority.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: The country covers an area of 10,972 square kilometers.
quickFacts.detail: It's one of the smallest countries in Europe.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The official currency is the Bosnian Convertible Mark (BAM).

quickFacts.label: Languages
quickFacts.description: The official languages are Bosnian, Serbian, and Croatian, all mutually intelligible.
quickFacts.detail: English is also increasingly spoken, especially in tourist areas.

climateData.title: Climate of Bosnia and Herzegovina
climateData.description: Bosnia and Herzegovina experiences a continental climate with hot summers and cold, snowy winters. Rainfall is relatively evenly distributed throughout the year, though mountainous regions receive more precipitation.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a gradual warming, with wildflowers blooming across the countryside. It's a beautiful time for hiking and exploring.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer is hot and dry, with average temperatures ranging from 20°C to 30°C. It's ideal for swimming, water sports, and outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings cooler temperatures and stunning fall foliage. It’s a great time for hiking and enjoying the changing landscapes.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is cold and snowy, with temperatures often dropping below freezing. It’s a good time for skiing, snowboarding, and enjoying winter sports.

naturalWonders.name: Una National Park
naturalWonders.description: Una National Park is a protected area renowned for its pristine river, the Una, and its diverse flora and fauna. The river’s turquoise waters and dramatic canyons offer stunning scenery and opportunities for adventure.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park encompasses a significant portion of the Una River valley, characterized by steep cliffs, lush forests, and a rich biodiversity. It’s a haven for hikers, kayakers, and nature enthusiasts.
viewingTips: Bring waterproof gear for river activities

naturalWonders.name: Veselinović Cave
naturalWonders.description: Veselinović Cave is one of the longest and most impressive cave systems in Bosnia and Herzegovina, featuring stunning stalactites and stalagmites.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Located in the Romanija area, the cave boasts a complex network of chambers and passages adorned with impressive speleothems. It’s a fascinating destination for speleologists and those interested in geological formations.
viewingTips: Follow the guidance of experienced guides

naturalWonders.name: Javor Mountain
naturalWonders.description: Javor Mountain is a prominent mountain range in central Bosnia, offering breathtaking views and challenging hiking trails.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The mountain is characterized by its rugged peaks, dense forests, and numerous glacial lakes. It’s a popular destination for hikers, climbers, and nature lovers.

biodiversityCategory.name: Forest Ecosystems
biodiversityCategory.description: Bosnia and Herzegovina is home to a diverse range of forest ecosystems, including deciduous forests, coniferous forests, and mixed forests. These forests play a crucial role in maintaining biodiversity and regulating climate.

statistics.details: Approximately 65% of Bosnia and Herzegovina is covered by forests.
More than 100 different tree species can be found in the country's forests.

notableSpecies.name: European Beech
notableSpecies.significance: A dominant species in many Bosnian forests, providing habitat for a wide range of animals.

notableSpecies.name: Old European Oak
notableSpecies.significance: A slow-growing, long-lived tree that is an important part of the forest ecosystem.

ecosystemData.title: Bosnian Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Bosnia and Herzegovina’s ecosystems are incredibly diverse, ranging from mountainous regions to karst landscapes and extensive forests. These ecosystems support a rich variety of plant and animal life, contributing significantly to the country’s biodiversity.

biodiversityCategories.name: Wetlands
biodiversityCategories.description: Bosnia and Herzegovina possesses a network of wetlands, including marshes, swamps, and floodplains, which are vital habitats for numerous species.

statistics.details: Approximately 100,000 hectares of land are designated as wetlands.

notableSpecies.name: White-tailed Eagle
notableSpecies.significance: A majestic bird of prey that relies on wetlands for breeding and foraging.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Bosnia and Herzegovina
activities.description: Bosnia and Herzegovina offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all levels of experience, from hiking and cycling to water sports and wildlife watching.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the country’s stunning mountains, forests, and canyons on foot.

activities.name: Mount Igman Hike
activities.description: A scenic hike to the summit of Mount Igman, offering panoramic views of the surrounding mountains.

activities.name: Una River Kayaking
activities.description: Paddle down the turquoise waters of the Una River, enjoying the stunning scenery and wildlife.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water sports on the country’s numerous lakes and rivers.

activities.name: Lake Javor Jezer Swimming
activities.description: Relax and swim in the crystal-clear waters of Lake Javor Jezer.

clothing.winter: Warm coat, hat, gloves, scarf, waterproof boots

equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, map, compass

safety: Inform someone of your hiking plans
